topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54775e8f6368720c9f1b0000#post_54775e8f6368720c9f1b0000
In 4 the only reason why the economy wasn't in a recession was because the AI were managing everyone's economies.  I can only imagine what the people working on the four AI were saying.

Programmer, "Dude; this is fucking stupid.  If you want to manage the economy then why now just make a AI to manage the economy instead of having it manage the economy through war?  That seems ineffecient and wasteful"
Patriots, "Yeehaw; hows abut yous a sut ups and gets backs to typings on the thingies instuds of criticizun. . criticizen. . err complaining"


Speaking of which there are actually supercomputers managing the economy and stock market(partially) already.  Personally I'm for having computers manage businesses on the stock market because when you get down to it what causes a recession or depression is massive amounts of human error all stacking on top of each other until everything falls apart.

topics.body:
Frozen is a much better movie if you miss the first 15 minutes or so. 
If you start from "do you want to build a snowman" it makes elsa's powers all the more scary and mysterious, it makes christoph seem genuinely crazy for most of the movie because you don't know he's friends with the trolls and it paints the king and queen in a more negative light and they honestly kinda deserve it. They weren't villains but they weren't exactly the greatest parents either. 

All you really lose is Elsa and Anna playing (which is pretty much lost as part of the plot of the movie anyway), the introduction of the ideas of a frozen mind and a frozen heart and the conception of Olaf. 

Also, freaking Olaf. Olaf doesn't need an entire song to explain his joke. All it had to be was "I love the idea of summer" "I'm gonna tell him" "don't you dare!" "Elsa's this way"
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9
